senses.de: A number that is more than the total of the rest of the numbers
senses.ex: In the election, the majority of the people voted for the new proposal.

Tips.title: Quantitative Context
Tips.description: Use 'majority' when referring to the greater part or number in a group of entities.
Tips.example: The majority of students prefer having classes online.

Tips.title: Not Always Total
Tips.description: 'Majority' indicates more than half, but not necessarily the whole.
Tips.example: A majority of the pie has been eaten, but some is left.

Tips.title: Subject Variability
Tips.description: Understand that 'majority' can apply to people, opinions, or objects in various contexts.
Tips.example: The majority of today's news articles focus on the environment.

senses.de: The age at which a person is officially considered an adult
senses.ex: She will reach the age of majority on her 18th birthday.

Tips.title: Legal Specificity
Tips.description: In legal contexts, 'majority' can refer to a specific age when legal responsibilities change.
Tips.example: Upon reaching the age of majority, you can vote and sign contracts.

Tips.title: Cultural Variation
Tips.description: The 'age of majority' differs by country; it's crucial to know the local legal age.
Tips.example: In Japan, the age of majority is 20.

senses.de: A status or rule by which decisions are decided by voting and the decision with more votes wins
senses.ex: The party's majority rule will determine our next steps.

Tips.title: Political Power
Tips.description: 'Majority' in politics often implies greater power or the ability to make decisions.
Tips.example: The political party with the majority will lead the government.

Tips.title: Voting Outcome
Tips.description: In decision-making, a 'majority' vote means more than half support one side.
Tips.example: The proposal was accepted by a majority vote.

Tips.title: Minority Contrast
Tips.description: 'Majority' is often used in contrast to 'minority,' representing the smaller group.
Tips.example: The majority approved the law, while the minority opposed it.

Bulk.wordDefinition:
Bulk refers to the physical amount or volume of something. For example, "I bought a bulk package of 24 rolls of toilet paper.".

It can also refer to the main part or larger portion of something. For example, "The bulk of the work is done, we just need to finish up the last few things.".

Bulk refers to physical amount and larger portion, while majority refers to greater number and most people.

Mass.wordDefinition:
Mass, on the other hand, refers to a large and indefinite number or quantity of people or things.

It describes a big, cohesive group or collection, like a mass of people at a concert.

Majority is used when referring to more than 50% of a group or total, while mass describes a large and indefinite collection of people or things.

Most.wordDefinition:
Most refers to the highest quantity or the largest number of something.

It is usually used when describing a general trend, a characteristic, or an observation. For example, if someone says that "most birds fly," they mean that a large number of birds do fly but not necessarily all birds do.

So to summarize, majority is used when comparing numbers or opinions, while most is used when describing a general trend or characteristic.

Preponderance.wordDefinition:
Preponderance refers to a greater amount or quantity of evidence that supports a specific conclusion. It means that there is more evidence supporting one side over the other.

For example, in a court case, the side with more compelling evidence would have a preponderance of evidence.

Majority refers to a larger number or amount of something, while preponderance refers to a greater amount or quantity of evidence supporting a specific conclusion.

Majority is applicable in situations where a large group or population is involved, while preponderance is applicable in legal and argumentative situations where evidence is weighed to determine validity.

quotes.Text: When you're doing a film and the majority of the film is cast black, for me, it's most important to get people to view those movies as just movies, as just good movies. At the end of the day, regardless of the color of the cast, we're all doing the same thing in this business: trying to make a good film.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Kevin Hart

quotes.Text: A collection of strong-minded individuals who have learned how to dismiss mistakes, disappointments and problems in their personal life make up a strong team. If the majority of the team have that then, as a unit, you are almost impossible to beat.
quotes.Title: English Athlete
quotes.Name: Gary Neville

quotes.Text: The truth does not require a majority to prevail, ladies and gentlemen. The truth is its own power. The truth will out. Never forget that.

quotes.Name: Rush Limbaugh

quotes.Text: The truth is that the vast majority of Americans are good, fair, and just, and they want their country to reflect those ideals.

quotes.Text: The wise have always said the same things, and fools, who are the majority have always done just the opposite.

quotes.Text: Tonight - to you, the great silent majority of my fellow Americans - I ask for your support.

quotes.Text: I think the majority of the Liberian people want peace.
